name: Death of Periodic Tenant
short_description: Tenancy inherited on death but landlord seeks possession

death_inheritance.timing: Proceedings must start within 12 months of death or landlord's knowledge

notice_timing.maximum: Proceedings must begin within 12 months of death
notice_timing.or: 12 months from when landlord became aware of death

notice_period.court_proceedings: Must be within 12 months of death/knowledge

evidence_required: Proof of succession (family relationship, evidence of residence)
Date landlord became aware of death
Evidence of who succeeded to tenancy

high_probability: Clear evidence of death and succession
Landlord has genuine need for property
medium_probability: Successor has some ties to property
low_probability: Successor has strong ties to property
Court considers it unreasonable to grant possession

red_flags: Successor has lived there for many years
No genuine reason for seeking possession
Successor has nowhere else to go

typical_timeline.deadline: Must start within 12 months of death

tenant_defenses: Successor has strong ties to property
notes: Ground 7 is DISCRETIONARY - court must consider if reasonable to grant possession. Time limit is strict - claims fail if outside 12 months. Courts sympathetic to vulnerable successors.
case_law: Tickner v Hearn [1960] - Reasonableness must be considered
Battlespring Ltd v Gates [1983] - 12 month limit strictly applied
court_considerations: When did death occur and when did landlord know?
Is it reasonable to grant possession given all circumstances?
